title: Dispute Over ‘Java Man’ Raises a  Question: Who Owns Prehistory?
description: An Indonesian claim against a Dutch museum has pushed the debate about restitution into the realm of the natural history museum — where it hasn’t been much of an issue until now.
dc:creator: Nina Siegal
media:credit: Ilvy Njiokiktjien for The New York Times
media:description: A skull cap belonging to Java Man, on display at the Naturalis Biodiversity Center in Leiden, the Netherlands. The ancient remains are believed to belong to Homo erectus, a “missing link” between humans and apes.
